required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Clinical Significance and Feasibility of CT Guided Biopsy of Double Site Lesions：A Preliminary Lung Centered Study
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Clinical Significance and Feasibility of CT Guided Biopsy of Double Site Lesions：A Preliminary Lung Centered Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to explore the clinical significance and feasibility of double site biopsy by analyzing the pathological characteristics and the incidence of main complications of CT guided puncture biopsy of lung and other parts coexisting lesions.

detailed_description.textblock: CT guided biopsy is minimally invasive, accurate and low cost. It is often used as an important diagnostic method when the clinical suspect of malignant disease or the treatment effect of the disease is not good. In patients with suspected malignant lung disease, metastasis of other parts of lung, pulmonary door, mediastinum, bone, and distant soft tissue may be combined at the same time. It is the key link of clinical work to evaluate the nature of these coexisting lesions accurately and choose appropriate treatment methods. At present, there is little clinical study on lung centered double site biopsy. This study aims to explore the clinical significance and feasibility of double site biopsy by analyzing the pathological characteristics and the incidence of main complications of CT guided puncture biopsy of lung and other parts coexisting lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: for the combination of two site biopsies
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of 4 kinds of combined pathological results in different lesion location groups was analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: for the combination of two site biopsy approaches 1
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of pneumothorax on the surgical side after unilateral lung biopsy

primary_outcome.measure: for the combination of two site biopsy approaches 2
primary_outcome.description: the incidence of pneumothorax on the surgical side after bilateral lung biopsy

primary_outcome.measure: for the combination of two site biopsy approaches 3
primary_outcome.description: the incidence of intra tissue hemorrhage after biopsy were statistically analyzed.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Clinical diagnosis of suspected malignant tumor by dual site CT guided needle biopsy

intervention.intervention_name: Double site CT guided needle biopsy
intervention.description: Double site CT guided needle biopsy
intervention.arm_group_label: Clinical diagnosis of suspected malignant tumor by dual site CT guided needle biopsy

study_pop.textblock: Clinical data of 134 consecutive patients with suspected malignancy who underwent dual site CT guided biopsy in the Third Hospital of Peking University from January 2011 to October 2014

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with suspected malignancy
- underwent dual site CT guided biopsy in the Third Hospital of Peking University
Exclusion Criteria:
-
